title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (October 15, 2019).

Trump authorized sanctions and raised steel tariffs on Turkey, while threatening more-powerful financial penalties if Ankara continued an offensive in northern Syria launched after he decided to withdraw U.S. troops from the region.

Syrian troops entered areas that have been outside their control for years after a quickly forged pact between Kurdish forces and the Assad regime.

Prosecutors are examining Giuliani's business dealings in Ukraine, including his finances, meetings and work for a city mayor there.

Trump's former top Russia adviser told House panels that she and others grew so alarmed about administration efforts to push Ukraine to open certain probes that they raised concerns with a White House lawyer.

China is using a widely downloaded mobile app and a translation service to collect billions of pieces of data within its borders and around the world.

A Fort Worth, Texas, police officer who fatally shot an African-American woman in her home was arrested and charged with murder.

A crucial week for Brexit began with Queen Elizabeth II presenting Johnson's vision for Britain outside the EU during a ceremony to reopen Parliament.

The Vatican's security chief resigned over leaks tied to a financial scandal over the Holy See's investments in London real estate.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 15, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
